key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges, including SEC settlements and cybersecurity breaches
Market volatility impacting investment management business
Intense competition in retirement and asset management sectors
Customer trust issues due to fee transparency and service quality complaints
controversies: $22.9 million SEC settlement in 2020 for disclosure failures and misleading statements
Cybersecurity breach in 2023 compromising personal information, leading to a $1 million SEC settlement
Customer complaints regarding account closures and unexpected fees
social_issues: Customer trust and ethical concerns due to past controversies around sales practices and fee disclosures
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and investor protection violations
Cybersecurity vulnerabilities and data security concerns

sources.title: SEC Charges Firm With Deficient Cybersecurity Procedures
sources.snippet: The SEC charged Voya Financial Advisors Inc. (VFA) with violating the Safeguards Rule and the Identity Theft Red Flags Rule, which are designed to protect confidential customer information and protect customers from the risk of identity theft. This is the first SEC enforcement action charging violations of the Identity Theft Red Flags Rule.
